text: 9Try 774 MTTHTf qifeta5rut Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (asa RT6- ar {Tf Tua4) Extn 2223/2318/2468/2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, Delhi-110045 No.11041/30/2003-Admn.III June 30,2003 POLICY MATTERS ADMINISTRATIONFINANCE ( 5012003) (Decision taken on Admn Division File No.11041/30/2003-Admn-III(Pt)Vol.IV) Sub: Engagement of legal firmsladvocates Based on our experience during the last two years and the feedbacklsuggestions received from the PIUsITechnical Divisions, it has been decided to dispense with the existing system of empanelment of law firmslsolicitors  Instead, the following procedure will henceforth be followed for engagement of legal firmsladvocates: Project Directors may engage advocatesllaw firms with atleast 10 years of experience in the relevant field for dealing with the cases of routine nature such as land acquisition etc. While doing sO, Project Directors should try to rotate the cases among a few advocates instead of entrusting cases to only one. (ii) In the matters related to contractslagreements or other important issues which may be of wider ramification for other projects as well, the Project Directors must seek   approval of Headquarters before   engaging an advvocate . If necessary, a suitable advocate to defend such cases could also be engaged from Headquarters. (iii) At Headquarters, the concerned Division may engage law firms having atleast 10 years experience in dealing with similar cases of Central/State Govt: organisations/PSUs. (iv) The prescribed schedule of fee is annexed. In case Divisional Heads/Project  Directors feel that there is a need of engagement of senior counselllaw firm at a rate higher than what has been prescribed in the schedule, prior approval of the Competent Authority must be obtained.
